title: Operating Systems
description: How computers manage hardware, memory, processes, and user interactions.

title: Computer Networks
description: How devices communicate over local and global networks using protocols.

title: Databases
description: Systems for storing, querying, and managing structured or unstructured data.

title: Cloud Computing
description: Delivery of computing services over the internet such as storage and processing.

title: Cybersecurity
description: Protecting systems, data, and networks from threats, exploits, and vulnerabilities.

title: DevOps
description: Combines development and operations to automate building, testing, and deployment.

title: API Design
description: Creating interfaces that allow applications and systems to communicate.

title: Virtualization
description: Running multiple isolated systems using shared physical hardware resources.

title: Containerization
description: Packaging applications with dependencies for consistent execution across environments.

title: Distributed Computing
description: Systems where multiple machines work together to process data or tasks.

title: Frontend Engineering
description: Building the user-facing portions of web applications and interfaces.

title: Backend Engineering
description: Server-side logic, data processing, APIs, and infrastructure management.

title: Full-Stack Development
description: Combining both frontend and backend development skills.

title: Data Engineering
description: Building pipelines and systems to move, transform, and clean data.

title: Machine Learning
description: Algorithms and models that enable computers to learn from data.

title: Natural Language Processing
description: Computational techniques for understanding and generating human language.

title: Computer Vision
description: Processing and interpreting visual data using algorithms and AI.

title: Game Development
description: Creating games using engines, physics, graphics, and gameplay systems.

title: Embedded Systems
description: Programming low-level devices such as sensors, microcontrollers, and IoT hardware.

title: Quantum Computing
description: Computation using quantum states for extremely complex problems.

title: Version Control
description: Tools and systems for tracking changes in code, usually Git.

title: Code Editors
description: Text editors designed for writing and managing source code.

title: Task Runners
description: Tools that automate repetitive development tasks like building or bundling.

title: Package Managers
description: Systems that install, update, and manage external libraries or dependencies.

title: Testing Frameworks
description: Tools for writing automated tests to validate application behavior.

title: Monitoring Tools
description: Systems that track application performance, uptime, and errors.

title: CI/CD Pipelines
description: Automated systems that continually build, test, and deploy code.

title: Command Line Tools
description: Utilities for interacting with systems through text-based commands.

title: Algorithm Design
description: Techniques for creating efficient procedures to solve computational problems.

title: Data Structures
description: Ways of organizing data for efficient storage and access.

title: Combinatorics
description: Counting and arranging possibilities in structured ways.

title: Graph Theory
description: Studying networks, nodes, edges, and relationships.

title: Statistics
description: Analyzing data using probability, distributions, and models.

title: Linear Algebra
description: Working with vectors, matrices, transformations, and high-dimensional data.

title: Calculus
description: Understanding change, rates, and optimization problems.

title: Probability Theory
description: Modeling uncertainty and random events.

title: Discrete Mathematics
description: Mathematics for computingâ€”logic, sets, functions, proofs.

title: Color Theory
description: Understanding color relationships and designing harmonious palettes.

title: Typography
description: Using fonts, spacing, and text structure for readability and style.

title: Layout & Composition
description: Arranging visual elements for balance, clarity, and flow.

title: 3D Modeling
description: Digital creation of objects, characters, and environments.

title: Animation Principles
description: Movement rules for smooth, believable animations.

title: Sound Design
description: Creating audio effects, ambience, and UI sound cues.

title: User Experience Design
description: Crafting intuitive and user-friendly digital experiences.

title: User Interface Design
description: Designing interactive visual elements of software.

title: Motion Graphics
description: Animating visual assets for UI, branding, or storytelling.

title: Concept Art
description: Early visual exploration of style, mood, and world-building.
